extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 32 jumbo shrimp (about 4 pounds), shelled and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing

extendedIngredients.name: sambal oelek
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon sambal oelek or other Asian chile sauce

title: Grilled Shrimp with Citrus-Sambal-Oelek Dressing
summary: Grilled Shrimp with Citrus-Sambal-Oelek Dressing might be just the main course you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 8 and costs $4.77 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 46g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 350 calories. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. A mixture of sambal oelek, olive oil, orange juice, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 59%, this dish is good. Try Grilled Shrimp With Citrus-sambal-oelek Dressing, Sambal Oelek Seitan Wings, and Javanese Sambal with Grilled Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Anne Amie Pinot Gris with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 14 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.

instructions: In a bowl, whisk the sambal oelek with the lemon juice, lime juice, orange juice and oregano. Whisk in the 1/2 cup of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.                                              Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Brush the shrimp with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the shrimp over moderate heat, turning once, until cooked through, about 8 minutes. Transfer the shrimp to plates and spoon the dressing on top. Serve.

steps.step: In a bowl, whisk the sambal oelek with the lemon juice, lime juice, orange juice and oregano.
Whisk in the 1/2 cup of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Light a grill or preheat a grill pan.
Brush the shrimp with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the shrimp over moderate heat, turning once, until cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Transfer the shrimp to plates and spoon the dressing on top.
